title: Giving Directions to Your Favorite Place
description: Write directions from a well-known location to your favorite place in your city.

prompt.topic: How to Get to My Favorite Place
prompt.description: Write directions from a famous location (like a subway station or landmark) to your favorite place in your neighborhood or city. This could be a cafe, restaurant, park, or shop.
requirements: Use direction words (turn left/right, go straight, pass, etc.)
Use prepositions of place (on, at, next to, between, opposite)
Describe the destination so readers can recognize it

exampleSentences.sentence: I want to tell you how to get to my favorite cafe.
exampleSentences.translation: 제가 좋아하는 카페 가는 길을 알려드릴게요.

exampleSentences.sentence: Start from Exit 3 of Gangnam Station.
Go straight for about two blocks.
The cafe is next to a bookstore.
It's a small cafe with blue doors. You can't miss it!
exampleSentences.translation: 파란 문이 있는 작은 카페예요. 못 지나칠 거예요!
exampleSentences.useCase: To describe how to recognize the place

vocabularyHelp.example: It's between the cafe and the bookstore.
It's a big building. You can't miss it.

usefulExpressions.example: Start from the subway station exit.
First, go straight. Then, turn right.
When you see the park, turn left.
It's about a 5-minute walk from the station.

items: Did you specify a clear starting point?
Did you use direction words correctly?
Did you use prepositions of place?
Did you describe the destination clearly?
Did you use imperatives for directions?
Are your sentences clear and grammatically correct?
Is your writing at least 80 words?
Is your writing no more than 120 words?
Are your directions concise but complete?
Could someone follow your directions easily?
Is the order of directions logical?
Did you complete within the time limit?
